org.mitre.provenance.db.neo4j

Class Neo4JPLUSObjectFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.db.neo4j.Neo4JPLUSObjectFactory

  • public class Neo4JPLUSObjectFactory
extends Object
    A factory to create provenance objects from things in the Neo4J storage layer. This class permits the API to load objects from the database, abstracting away the details of the database.

    Note! If you want to report provenance, you probably shouldn't be using this class. To report provenance to a database either locally or remotely, please investigate the AbstractProvenanceClient class, and its child implementing classes.

    Author:
    moxious

      • MAX_OBJECTS

        public static int MAX_OBJECTS
        The maximum number of objects that will be returned when creating a graph. Graphs are stored in memory, so this helps balance memory needs.

        public static int DEFAULT_SEARCH_RESULTS
        The number of search results you get when you don't specify how many you want.

      • getIncidentEdges

        public static ProvenanceCollection getIncidentEdges(Iterable<String> oids,
                                                    User user,
                                                    String direction,
                                                    boolean includeProvEdges,
                                                    boolean includeNPEs)
                                             throws PLUSException
        Get edges incident to a particular set of object identifiers.
        Parameters:
        oids - the set of PLUSObject oids to search for
        user - the user who wants the data
        direction - which set of edges you want. Can be "bling", "fling", or "both". All other values throw an exception.
        includeNPEs - if true, the resulting collection will include NonProvenanceEdge objects.
        Returns:
        a ProvenanceCollection containing the search results.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • newDAG

        public static LineageDAG newDAG(String id,
                                User user,
                                TraversalSettings settings)
                         throws PLUSException

        Creates a new DAG, with configurable properties, and a full DAG fingerprint. This method will call the surrogate algorithm and compute what the specified user is permitted to see of the underlying data.

        Given that the DAG can start from multiple points, there is no connectedness guarantee about the result that will be returned.

        Parameters:
        id - the starting point to spider out from
        user - the user viewing the DAG, which will be used as part of the surrogate algorithm to compute what they are permitted to see
        settings - the settings used to control how the graph is discovered.
        Returns:
        a LineageDAG object.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • __newDAG

        public static LineageDAG __newDAG(Iterable<String> ids,
                                  User user,
                                  int maxNodes,
                                  int maxHops,
                                  boolean includeNodes,
                                  boolean includeEdges,
                                  boolean includeNonProvenanceEdges,
                                  boolean followNPIDs)
                           throws PLUSException
        Deprecated. use TraversalSettings instead

        Creates a new DAG, with configurable properties, and a full DAG fingerprint. This method will call the surrogate algorithm and compute what the specified user is permitted to see of the underlying data.

        Given that the DAG can start from multiple points, there is no connectedness guarantee about the result that will be returned.

        Parameters:
        ids - an iterable set of object IDs that should be included in the DAG
        user - the user viewing the DAG, which will be used as part of the surrogate algorithm to compute what they are permitted to see
        maxNodes - the maximum number of nodes to include in the DAG.
        maxHops - the maximum number of hops away to fetch graph items.
        includeNodes - if true, the DAG will include nodes. If false, it will not.
        includeEdges - if true, the DAG will include provenance edges. If false, it will not.
        includeNonProvenanceEdges - if true, the DAG will include NPEs. If false, it will not.
        followNPIDs - if true, the "spider" that discovers the graph will follow non-provenance IDs. If false, it will not. For example, if a node (A) is linked to an MD5 sum as an external identifier, and that MD5 sum is linked to some other provenance object (B), then that object B may be included in the resulting DAG (subject to maxNodes) even if there is no provenance relationship between A and B.
        Returns:
        a LineageDAG object.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • searchFor

        public static ProvenanceCollection searchFor(String term,
                                             User user)
        Search for provenance objects by name.
        Parameters:
        term - a search term to use to match names

      • extractCollection

        public static ProvenanceCollection extractCollection(org.neo4j.cypher.javacompat.ExecutionResult er,
                                                     User viewer)
                                              throws PLUSException
        Extract a ProvenanceCollection out of an execution result. This method is ideal for creating provenance collections from the results of cypher queries. Any column that comes from the query that contains a java primitive will be ignored; only relationships and nodes will be examined.
        Parameters:
        er - the execution result of a cypher query
        viewer - the user who views the collection
        Returns:
        a collection containing the provenance contents of er, according to viewer's view.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • transmogrify

        protected static Object transmogrify(org.neo4j.graphdb.Node n)
                              throws PLUSException
        Figure out the most appropriate PLUS type to turn a node into, and return that.
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        either a NonProvenanceEdge, an Actor, or a PLUSObject depending on what's appropriate.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • transmogrify

                              throws PLUSException
        Figure out the most appropriate PLUS type to turn a given relationship into, and return that.
        Parameters:
        r -
        Returns:
        either a PLUSEdge or a NonProvenanceEdge, depending on what's appropriate.
        Throws:
        PLUSException
